This classic crime film tells the story of the Corleone family, which is made up of powerful Mafia bosses such as Don Vito Corleone (Marlon Brando), Sonny Corleone (Al Pacino), and Tommy Corleone (James Caan).
The film follows the Corleone family's rise to power, as well as their struggles with loyalty, greed, and morality.
2. "Goodfellas" (1992) - Directed by Martin Scorsese and starring Ray Liotta, Robert De Niro, Joe Pesci, and Lillo Treadwell.
This iconic crime film tells the story of mobster Henry "Hank" Paulson Jr. (Ray Liotta), who is hired by the Corleone family to help them increase their power in organized crime in New York City during the 1970s through the 1980s.
The film follows Paulson's rise within the Corleone family, as well as his struggles with loyalty, greed, and morality.
